assayComponentEndpointDesc:
Data from the assay component NVS_LGIC_rGABAR_NonSelective was analyzed into 1 assay endpoint. This assay endpoint, NVS_LGIC_rGABAR_NonSelective, was analyzed in the positive analysis fitting direction relative to DMSO as the negative control and baseline of activity. 
Using a type of binding reporter, loss-of-signal activity can be used to understand changes in the binding as they relate to the gene Gabra1. 
Furthermore, this assay endpoint can be referred to as a primary readout, because the performed assay has only produced 1 assay endpoint. 
To generalize the intended target to other relatable targets, this assay endpoint is annotated to the ion channel intended target family, where the subfamily is ligand-gated ion channel.
assayComponentDesc: NVS_LGIC_rGABAR_NonSelective is one of one assay component(s) measured or calculated from the NVS_LGIC_rGABAR_NonSelective assay. It is designed to make measurements of radioligand binding, a form of binding reporter, as detected with scintillation counting signals by Filter-based radiodetection technology.
assayComponentTargetDesc: Changes to scintillation counting signals produced from the receptor-ligand binding of the key ligand [[3H]-GABA] are indicative of a change in receptor function and kinetics for the Norway rat gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) A receptor, alpha 1 [GeneSymbol:Gabra1 | GeneID:29705 | Uniprot_SwissProt_Accession:P62813].
assayDesc: NVS_LGIC_rGABAR_NonSelective is a biochemical, single-readout assay that uses extracted gene-proteins from Rat whole brain in a tissue-based cell-free assay. Measurements were taken 1 hour after chemical dosing in a 48-well plate.
assaySourceDesc: NovaScreen, part of PerkinElmer, a human and environmental health company, provides a large diverse suite of cell-free binding and biochemical assays.

citations.title: Stereospecificity and structure--activity requirements of GABA receptor binding in rat brain
citations.author: Enna SJ, Collins JF, Snyder SH
citations.citation: Enna SJ, Collins JF, Snyder SH. Stereospecificity and structure--activity requirements of GABA receptor binding in rat brain. Brain Res. 1977 Mar 18;124(1):185-90. PubMed PMID: 191147.
